title: Thornham Magna Walks

images.title: Entrance to Thornham Estate, Suffolk by nick macneill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Entrance to Thornham Estate, Suffolk. The original Thornham Hall, was built in the Tudor period on an E-shaped plan and remodelled in the 17th century and again in the second half of the 19th century, by Sydney Smirke, to resemble a French château. The current house, built in 1956 in historical style, is now operated by the ninth Baron Henniker and his wife as a bed and breakfast

images.title: Richard Rice / Thornham Walks
images.caption: Thornham Walks Thornham Estate is a beautiful place to walk and is open to the public each day. This photograph shows the start of the walks close to the Café and Field Centre. There are 12 miles of footpaths through ancient parkland, woodland, farmland and water meadows. The walk shown here has a surfaced path suitable for push chairs and wheelchairs.

images.title: Eric Woodhouse / The Mews Thornham Walks
images.caption: The Mews Thornham Walks

images.title: Nat Bocking / Water Tower at Thornham Hall
images.caption: Water Tower at Thornham Hall. Late 19th Century estate tower beside a restaurant.

images.caption: Into The Walled Garden

images.title: Cottages between Thornham Magna and Parva by Adrian S Pye, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Richard Slessor / Four Horseshoes, Thornham Magna
images.caption: Four Horseshoes, Thornham Magna. A Grade II listed pub in the village.

images.title: Assorted houses, The Street, Thornham Magna by nick macneill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Assorted houses, The Street, Thornham Magna. The village has several oak-beamed, thatched Tudor houses, a forge workshop, and a village hall.

description: This attractive Suffolk village includes a 14th century church, a fine 15th century pub and wonderful walking trails in the Thornham Hall Estate. This walk from the village visits the Thornham Walks on the Thornham Estate. The estate has some well maintained trails taking you around the expansive estate's beautiful parkland and ancient woodlands. Features in the park include a lovely walled garden, glasshouses, fishing lakes, a memorial wood, a pinetum with conifers and wildflowers, a butterfly ride and water meadows where you can look out for a variety of wildfowl. There's also a car park, cafe and some wonderful carved sculptures to admire.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a nice on site cafe on the Thornham Estate or you could head into the village and visit the 15th century Four Horseshoes. This beautiful thatched pub serves fine food and also provides accommodation. You can find them at Wickham Rd, Thornham Magna, IP23 8HD.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The estate is a great place for a dog walk with some fine woodland trails for them to enjoy. You are asked to keep them on leads due to the livestock. The Four Horseshoes pub mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the east is the neighbouring town of Eye where you can visit the 11th century Norman castle and a particularly fine 16th century pub.

display_address: The Street, Thornham Magna, Mid Suffolk, Suffolk, England, IP23 8HB, United Kingdom
